page.title: 02Farming in S.Derbyshire
page.content: Much of the area is of Grade 3 agricultural land with pockets of higher quality of Grade 2 land to the north and east. As a result there is considerable variety both in the size and type of farms. In fact of the 9 farms included, 4 are mixed, 2 are dairy farms, 2 rear beef cattle and 1 is arable. Several of the smaller farms are family businesses, handed down through 2 or 3 generations. For this reason they do not employ farmworkers. The larger farms do depend on outside help although the number of employees is small compared to that of twenty years ago. This explains why many tied cottages have been sold to people outside the farming industry.
